Generation IV.Diamond: Its claws loose electricity with enough amperage to cause fainting. They live in small groups.
Generation IV.Pearl: It rests its forelegs on others to communicate with rhythmic electric pulses from its claws.
Generation IV.Platinum: Strong electricity courses through the tips of its sharp claws. A light scratch causes fainting in foes.
Generation IV.HeartGold: By gathering their tails together, they collectively generate powerful electricity from their claws.
Generation IV.SoulSilver: By gathering their tails together, they collectively generate powerful electricity from their claws.

Generation VIII.Sword: By joining its tail with that of another Luxio, this Pokémon can receive some of the other Luxio's electricity and power up its own electric blasts.
Generation VIII.Shield: Upon encountering an opponent, this Pokémon prepares for battle by extending its claws, which can put out 1,000,000 volts of electricity.
Generation VIII.Brilliant Diamond: Its claws loose electricity with enough amperage to cause opponents to faint. It lives in small groups.
Generation VIII.Shining Pearl: It rests its forelegs on others to communicate with rhythmic electric pulses from its claws.
Generation VIII.Legends: Arceus: Proudly uses its electrified claws as weapons. It seems to be a gracious Pokémon, evenly sharing the spoils of the hunt with others of its kind.

Generation IX.Scarlet: Strong electricity courses through the tips of its sharp claws. A light scratch causes fainting in foes.
Generation IX.Violet: By gathering their tails together, they collectively generate powerful electricity from their claws.
